body: That makes sense, actually. Curl doesn't send an `Accept` header (unless you give it one), so the API defaults to the JSON format which doesn't use any templates. Browsers send `Accept: text/html`, so DRF responds with a pretty HTML view that uses templates. You can also specify the format with a query string: `/api/v1/recipe/?format=json`.
